metadata.title: CVE-2023-23455 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
atm_tc_enqueue in net/sched/sch_atm.c in the Linux kernel through 6.1.4allows attackers to cause a denial of service because of type confusion(non-negative numbers can sometimes indicate a TC_ACT_SHOT condition ratherthan valid classification results).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23455` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-lowlatency - 4.4.0-239.273
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-208-generic - 4.15.0-208.219~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-208-generic - 4.15.0-208.219~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-208-lowlatency - 4.15.0-208.219~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1118-kvm - 4.4.0-1118.128
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1155-aws - 4.4.0-1155.170
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1153-aws - 4.15.0-1153.166~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1147-gcp - 4.15.0-1147.163~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1116-oracle - 4.15.0-1116.127~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-239.273').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-208.219~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1118.128').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1155.170').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1153.166~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1162.177~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1147.163~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1116.127~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
